intro: Sagraea rugosa, commonly known as the rough sagraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features rough, hairy stems and leaves that are often grayish-green in color. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central disk, blooming in spring and early summer. Sagraea rugosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
